info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 3:50PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Missoula, Deer Lodge, Granite, northeastern Ravalli, northwestern Silver Bow and Powell Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 348 PM MDT, multiple reports of a frontal boundary with thunderstorms producing strong to potentially damaging winds, extending from along a line 12 miles northeast of Bonner-West Riverside to 6 miles northwest of Wisdom. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...NWS Employees. Official NWS observations. Public. Automated weather observation units. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Deer Lodge, Drummond, Anaconda, Butte, Silver Bow, Philipsburg, Walkerville, Ovando, Galen, Warm Springs, Gregson Hot Springs, Bonner-West Riverside, Garrison, West Valley, East Missoula, Nimrod, Finn, Jens and Brock Creek. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 102 and 221. Highway 12 Garrison to MacDonald Pass between mile markers 0 and 26. Highway 83 between mile markers 0 and 4. Highway 93 S between mile markers 92 and 94. Highway 200 E between mile markers 0 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If on or near a lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
